title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 January 2017 - XWiki
content:
has quit 02:27  has joined #xwiki 06:26  has joined #xwiki 06:34  has quit 06:34  has quit 06:34  has quit 06:34  has quit 06:34  has quit 06:34  has quit 06:34  has quit 06:59  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:12  has joined #xwiki 07:35  has joined #xwiki 07:43  has joined #xwiki 07:57  has quit 08:06  has joined #xwiki 08:07  has quit 08:15  has joined #xwiki 08:25  has quit 08:44  has joined #xwiki 08:52  has joined #xwiki 08:52  has quit 08:59  has joined #xwiki 09:22  has joined #xwiki 09:40  has joined #xwiki 09:43  has joined #xwiki 09:48  has quit 09:52  has joined #xwiki 09:56  has quit 10:18  has joined #xwiki 10:21  hello, here my quick, tiny, silly question of new year ;-) with xwiki syntax I didn't found a way to display an unbreakable space character (more simple than "{{html}} {{/html}}"). ty 10:28  has joined #xwiki 10:30  has joined #xwiki 10:43  Pbas: in XWiki syntax white spaces are unbreakable 10:44  ok thxs I will try that 10:44  to be more precise all white spaces to put in a xwiki/2.x content will be visible 10:45  will be visible? 10:45  so if you put several white space for example you will end up in html with  white space followed by as many   as needed to have the same number of white spaces visually in your browser 10:46  i.e. not all white spaces are converted to   but enough are so that you see them all in your browser 10:47  that's the rule for most of the syntax, there is very specific places like before list syntax where the white spaces are not kept 10:48  anyway just put several white space and see the result, best explanation :) 10:50  If I typing "un espace" in wiki editor I haven't a   displayed between "un" and "espace" 10:53  yes, as I said you get   only if you have several white spaces 10:53  so that you "see" all of them 10:53  haaa 10:53  not all white space end up as unbreakable spaces 10:57  right. "un  espace" (with 2 blank) displayed "un  espace" but I can not have "un espace"? 10:58  since there is a UTF8 code for unbreakable space you can probably just insert one in the content 10:58  need to copy/paste it from somewhere or find how to write one with your keyboard 10:58  yes I didn't think about utf-8 character (I will test it) 11:01  I copy/pasted it from http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/00a0/index.htm in http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/WhiteSpace 11:03  does not seems to go trough 11:03  the browser ends up with a simple white space from what I can see 11:03  (difficult to check if it is unbreakable space) 11:03  I checked with a hex editor 11:16  If I look at your Whitespace page wih firebug (with displayed the entity in unicode): I see:

toto tyty          

11:17  actually UTF8 is not required, looks like non breacking white space ascii code is 160 according to http://www.ascii-code.com/ 11:18  but then not sure how browser react to it 11:19  and with xwiki syntax I can write an ascii character? 11:20  there is no code for ascii character no but I mean it should be supported by any encoding 11:20  "just" need to find some vistual keyboard or something to copy/paste 11:20  in thgeory 11:20  theory 11:21  ok it is not simple  (because it is for normal user) 11:22  yes not simple 11:22  I guess we could imagine some button in the WYSIWYG for this 11:22  actually maybe CKEditor have this already 11:23  but then It's possible XWiki html parser convert $nbsp; to SpaceBlock internall which end up as white space 11:24  which would probably deserve a bug on jira from "real" non breaking white spaces support point of view 11:25  depends what the XML parser used by XWiki html parser does when it hits $nbsp; 11:25  A nice way would be typing "  " 2 blank, to generate "$nbsp;" 11:27  The Ckeditor have a "insert special character" menu but didn't propose unbreakable space 11:28  looks like + is suposed to generate non breaking space on Windows from what I see on Google 11:28  does not work in Ubuntu it seems 11:29  + on Mac from what I am told 11:31  Our users have windows desktop, I must try this way (time to start another PC bc I'm under Debian) 11:45  Nope! With win7 + xwiki editor, Maj Space doesn't work 11:54  Ok I think I tell my user to use "{{html}} {{/html}}" bc the don't use this character frequently 12:01  Ho another way, like you said with copy/paste form LibreOffice:  AltGr + Space and copy/paste to xwiki editor :) 12:31  has quit 13:23  has joined #xwiki 14:28  has quit 14:31  has joined #xwiki 14:37  has quit 14:38  has joined #xwiki 14:44  has quit 14:44  has joined #xwiki 14:45  has quit 14:50  has quit 14:52  has joined #xwiki 15:23  has quit 15:48  has joined #xwiki 15:52  has quit 15:59  has joined #xwiki 16:08  has quit 16:41  has left #xwiki 16:43  has joined #xwiki 16:50  has quit 17:02  has joined #xwiki 17:29  has quit 17:32  has quit 17:47  has joined #xwiki 17:53  has quit 18:06  has joined #xwiki 18:10  has quit 18:11  has joined #xwiki 18:30  has quit 18:30  has joined #xwiki 18:33  has quit 18:33  has quit 18:36  has quit 18:41  has joined #xwiki 18:48  has quit 18:48  has quit 18:55  has quit 18:57  has joined #xwiki 19:19  has joined #xwiki 19:30  has quit 19:33  has quit 19:36  has quit 19:45  has joined #xwiki 19:50  has joined #xwiki 19:52  has quit 20:03  has joined #xwiki 20:10  has quit 20:15  has joined #xwiki 20:22  has quit 20:45  has quit 20:54  has joined #xwiki 21:15  has quit 21:23  has joined #xwiki 21:27  has quit 22:21  has joined #xwiki 22:28  has quit
